result.execSummary:
The defendant Sonja Kay Gillespie was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Intentionally Cause Harm, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(2)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: No contact directly or indirectly with victim, N.A.G., his/her residence, school, or elsewhere, without consent from Agent or Human Services.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sonja Kay Gillespie

records.addlTxt: Defendant Sonja Kay Gillespie in court with attorney Walter H Isaacson.  Jodi Dabson Bollendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Guilty plea; Court finds defendant guilty.  PSI WAIVED.  Sentence withheld, Court orders $518 costs, bond to apply from 12CF1752; no contact with victim, N.A.G., without consent from Agent or Human Services; 8 days sentence credit if revoked.  Felon warnings advised.

Defendant Sonja Kay Gillespie in court with attorney Walter H Isaacson.  Anne Theresa Nack appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motions to be filed by 2-15-2016.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 23, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury selection scheduled for March 28, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for March 28, 2016 at 08:30 am.
